definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword

sentences.english: He stood like a swordsman in a ballet.
sentences.chinese: 他站着的姿势活象一位芭蕾舞中的剑客。
她是那个时代最优秀的剑客。

sentences.english: The great swordsman people say was ever written?
sentences.chinese: 人们说这是至今最伟大的剑客？

sentences.english: "She was a swordsman, " he said finally.
sentences.chinese: “她是一名武士，一名剑客，”他终于开口了。

sentences.english: The greatest swordsman had missed his target completely, yet he continued to smile.
sentences.chinese: 最伟大的剑客失了准头，而他仍在笑。

sentences.english: With the sword of Kuina’s, Zolo embarked on the road to becom the No.1 swordman in the world.
sentences.chinese: 带着古伊娜的剑，卓洛踏上了成为天下第一剑客之路。

sentences.english: At last, there were the best thirty swordsmen attended the final match.
sentences.chinese: 最后选出最精锐的剑客三十位进行决赛。

sentences.english: Matajuro became the greatest swordsman in the land.
As you know, I favor swordsman.
Bring champagne and a Three Musketeers bar"?"
sentences.chinese: 带香槟和三剑客糖果棒？

sentences.english: He was the best wizard and she was the best swordsman.
From that day on, the three of them aspire to be musketeers.
sentences.chinese: 从那天起，他们三个立志成为三剑客。

definition: great scholar respected for learning and integrity
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
the Saint of War (i.e. the deified Guan Yu 關羽|关羽[Guan1 Yu3])
Asura, malevolent spirits in Indian mythology
